condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Caregivers and children are practicing an essential set of behaviours ensuring a continuum of health and nutrition care, especially for children and mothers

description.narrative: A gender-responsive communication strategy to support stunting reduction was developed for Punjab and Sindh provinces and implementation is underway which will result in increasing awareness and knowledge, and promote appropriate behaviours for mothers and fathers to support exclusive breastfeeding and complementary feeding for children at household and community levels. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:27/12/2017

title.narrative: % of children consuming minimum acceptable diet 06 24 months. (CCPD)

actual.value:
2017:Long-term indicator for behaviour change. National: 15% Punjab: 12.5% Sindh: 8.9%
IYCF communication material and social mobilization activities are implemented in KP & FATA, Balochistan, Sindh and Punjab.
To generate evidence around complementary feeding practices, SMART & KAP surveys in 16 d
